description: From   Portuguese or Spanish pargo, from Latin phagrum, accusative of phager, from Ancient Greek φάγρος (phágros, “sea bream”).
The similarity of porgy to paugie, especially in non-rhotic accents, may have reinforced both terms.

definitionGroups.group: Any of several fish of the family Sparidae; the seabream.

entries.meaning: In particular, the scup (paugie, Stenotomus chrysops).
